critique: The document expresses concern and determination to address mental health issues, suicide, and the opioid crisis. It acknowledges the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on mental health and outlines a plan to improve services and coordination. The language is formal and emphasizes the government's commitment to these issues. Therefore, sadness and concern are the most prominent emotions, followed by a sense of determination and hope. There is a slight element of surprise at the extent of the mental health crisis.
